dict.string: 1. Which of the following is (are) true about publishing a Web page? The WWW committee must certify that all information is accurate. The WWW committee must certify that all information is up-to-date.
A collection of commercial sites that offer free disk space but sell advertising space
The portion of computers on the Internet that communicate via FTP
The portion of computers on the Internet that communicate via HTTP
A collection of commercial sites that sell products and services
2. Of the following, which is the most accurate characterization of the World Wide Web ?
person who collects and manipulates Web pages
program that provides information requested by a Web client
special computer used to run powerful Web browsers
Web browser used on a client computer
3. The term Web server refers to a
It allows Web sites to trace the geographical location of a client.
It specifies the location of a Web page.
It describes how text in a Web page is to be formatted.
It sells customers connections to the Internet.
4. In the context of the World Wide Web, which of the following is true about a Uniform Resource Locator ?
Information on the Web might not be accurate.
Web organizations ensure that information on the Web is accurate.
Web server programs ensure that information on the Web is accurate.
Web administrators ensure that information on the Web is accurate.
5. Which of the following is true about the accuracy of information on the Web ?

6. Which of the following statements is (are) true about the Internet ? The Internet is a computer network. The Internet is a synonym for the World Wide Web. The Internet is a service offered by the World Wide Web.
7. Which of the following can be inferred from the URL of a file ? Location of the file Communication protocol used to transfer the file
It is a service that runs on the Internet.
It is a collection of all the data accessible over the Internet.
It consists of all the computers around the world.
It is a network of computers that provide multimedia information.
8. What is the World Wide Web?
9. A Web server and a Web client communicate using the _____ protocol .
10. Which of the following must be obtained in order to publish information in the Web ? Authorization to publish Web pages from the WWW organization Certificate of accuracy of contents from ARPA
prefix every line of the enclosed text with its line number
instruct the browser to ignore line feeds in the enclosed text
instruct the browser to ignore the space in the enclosed text
required and must be the URL of an image file
optional and when used must be the size of an image file
optional and when used must be the URL of an image file
required and must be the size of an image file

17. A browser uses these in deciding how to display text

?

21. Which of the following is a language used to design Web pages ?
block of text that a user can click
server on which a Web page resides
piece of symbolism used to specify structure or format
22. In the context of HTML, the term tag refers to a
annotation of text to specify structure and formatting
an increase in the price charged to access the Web
the process of publishing a document to a server
23. In the context of HTML, the term markup refers to
causing the Web page to be slow to download
making the Web page hard to read
24. Which of the following is least likely to be an effect of including too many graphics in a Web page?
26.Which of the following could not be a clickable link in a Web page ?
27. Which of the following path formats can be used to specify the value of the href attribute of the <a> tag? An absolute path A relative path
because a reader of one page may wish to refer to the other
so you don't lose any pages
28. The main reason to connect two pages in a large Web site via a hyperlink is
29. Which of the following are tags for changing the logical style of text ? <EM> and <CITE> <STRONG> and <SAMP> <B> and <I>
Logical styles are intended to specify the look of content, whereas physical styles are used to specify the meaning of content.
Logical styles are intended to be used for text, whereas physical styles are intended to be used for graphics.
Logical styles are intended to be used for graphics, whereas physical styles are intended to be used for text.
Logical styles are intended to specify the meaning of content, whereas physical styles are used to specify the look of content.
30. What is the conceptual difference between logical and physical styles ?
31. When a Web browser submits an HTML form to a Web server, the browser sends

32. Which of the following is (are) necessary for a radio button or checkbox control in an HTML form to be considered successful? It must be checked or selected. The HTML FORM element in which it appears must contain at least one INPUT element with a type of hidden. The HTML element that defines it must set a value for the attribute named value.
the encoding standard used to encode the data of the form
the processing agent to which the data of the form is submitted
the network protocol used to submit the data of the form
a list of form controls to submit
33. The action attribute of an HTML FORM element determines

34. Consider the following events, which occur during the processing of a Java servlet . The servlet generates HTML on the fly The server sends a response to client The servlet sends a response to server The client sends a request to server Which of the following indicates the order in which these events typically occur?

35. Which of the following HTML INPUT elements will result in a check box that appears initially in a checked state? <input name='chkbox' type='checkbox'> <input name='chkbox' type='checkbox' value='checked'> <input name='chkbox' type='checkbox' value='checkbox' checked='checked' >

36. For a given Java servlet, which of the following events typically result(s) in the termination of the servlet? The servlet completes a request and forwards its response to the server. The server sends a servlet's response to a client.
ensure the servlet is loaded and initialized
restart any running instance of the servlet
forward the request to the client browser
formulate a response to be sent to the client browser
37. Before a Java servlet can process a request, the Web server must first
38. Typically, a request from a client browser is forwarded to a servlet by a
39. Through a _____, Java servlets respond _____ to requests from clients .
41. In Java programming, a programmer creates _____ files, and then a compiler translates them to _____ files.
43. Upon compilation, the source code of a Java class MyClass will be stored in the file _____, and the corresponding byte code will be stored in the file _____.
ignore the syntax errors and create a compiled program without the lines containing errors
fail to complete the compilation and report a guess of what and where the errors are
fail to complete the compilation and report the exact location of each error
fix the syntax errors and complete the compilation
44. When compiling a Java program that contains syntax errors , the compiler will always
45. How many ".class" files will be generated after a successful compilation of any ".java" file?
write better comments in the program solution
rewrite the problem using fewer words
reduce syntax errors in the program solution
46. Redefining a problem is often done so the programmer can
The best way to program is to begin coding immediately, and then to follow up by testing.
Programming can be made easier by dividing a larger problem into smaller pieces.
Most of the time spent in programming is usually spent planning the solution to a problem.
47. Which of the following statements is true of the process of programming ?

48. When a Java class is designed, which of the following is a part (are parts) of the planning stage? Deciding how to display the results Writing a problem definition Identifying the data needed to solve the problem
49. In addition to coding, the process of programming model involves which of the following? Evaluation and testing Defining and redefining a problem Planning a solution to a problem

public class Hello extends Greeting

Constructors can only accept primitive Java types as parameters .
Constructors can only return 0 or a negative integer.
Constructors must be declared for every class.
58. In Java, which of the following is true about constructors ?
only the classes in the same package as Hello
only the class Hello and the subclasses of Hello

65. Which of the following statements is true about methods in Java ?
Every method must be declared public. Every method must accept at least one parameter . Every method must return a value.

69. In Java, a method with the same name as its class is known as a
72. Java provides eight types for storing and using simple data: byte, short, int, long, float, double, char, and boolean. Which of these types are used to store the logical values true and false?

73. Which of the following are primitive Java types ?
int Integer Double

80. In Java, for primitives, the assignment operator is the symbol _____ and the equality operator is the symbol _____.

81. What will be output upon execution of the following Java statement ?
System.out.println((int)(3.6%1.5*10));

83. Which of the following Boolean expressions involving the int variable i will always evaluate to true, regardless of the value of i ?
(i < 10) != (i >= 10) (i == 0) == (!(i != 0)) (i < 0) || (i > 0)
including a line like "declare counter int;" in a class definition outside of any method definitions
including them as formal arguments to class methods
including a line like "int counter;" in a class definition outside of any method definitions
84. Instance variables in a Java class are declared by
age is an instance variable and counter is a local variable
age is a local variable and counter is an instance variable
both age and counter are instance variables
both age and counter are local variables
86. The value of the largest index of an instance of class java.util.Vector is always _____ the size of the vector .
87. Which of the following Java statements correctly declares and instantiates a Vector v ?
Class A is a subclass of class B.
Class A must also extend class Applet.
Class B must also extend at least one other class.
Class B is a subclass of class A.
89. Which of the following kinds of relationships between classes does inheritance describe ?
90. Which of the following indicates that class Dog is a subclass of class Animal ?
Applet is a subclass of Hello
Hello is a subclass of Applet
Applet is an instance of Hello
Hello is an instance of Applet

94. If class A is a subclass of class B, which of the following statements is (are) true ?
All public data and methods of class B are available to class A. All public data and methods of class A are available to class B.
95. If the following line of code is the beginning of a class definition, then class _____ is being defined, and it is a _____ of class _____. public class Game extends Applet
